I've bought cherokee scrubs for years now and I've always been happy with the stretch and comfort of them, up until now. This top has weird proportions. The body is wide and short and the sleeves are super narrow. So great for short people who have a bigger middle and tiny arms, but not so great for everyone else. Since it is so short, it defeats the purpose of being a surgical scrub top as it constantly comes untucked. Not such a big deal if it is under a surgical gown, but more of a nuisance.

The Cherokee PEWTER GRAY is darker than most brands.  Fit is as expected.  I really like the cut of this top because it is shorter legnth and I am 5'2"  - so have a shorter torso.  It is meant to be able to tuck in or leave out.  The Cherokee revolution brand has a super soft feel with a little more thickness to it, unlike some brands that are super thin.  Would buy again in other colors.
A little tight in the shoulders and the slits up the sides are a little far up but it works and good for the price.
This is my favorite scrub top. It looks cute tucked in or left out and is very comfortable. I have bought a few of these as I like them so much. Fit was as expected.
Really short, tight in the chest, and cheap, stiff, scratchy material. I expected better since my other sets from them have been great.

This top is really beautiful, love the fabric - very rich looking, but the seam across the chest was too tight, while the rounded hem and plain - no pocket lower half is too roomy on me.  It looks like a maternity top, IMO.  I'm 5', 110lbs, 36c.
I love that you can tuck this top in or wear it out like in the picture. It is higher cut in the sides. The chest area is very fitted but overall it's a smooth wrinkle free material and very soft.
